snippet: Testimony at a London hearing on the 2006 poisoning death of Alexander V. Litvinenko, a former K.G.B. officer, also suggested that he had been a paid agent of British intelligence.
abstract: Testimony at London hearing on 2006 poisoning death of former KGB officer Alexander V Litvinenko offers evidence of Russian state involvement and indicates that he had been paid agent of M16, British Secret Intelligence Service.
lead_paragraph: Testimony at a London hearing on the 2006 poisoning death of Alexander V. Litvinenko, a former K.G.B. officer, also suggested that he had been a paid agent of British intelligence.

headline.seo: Evidence of Russian State Role in Death of Poisoned Spy Is Cited
headline.main: Russian State Role Seen in Death of Poisoned Spy
headline.print_headline:
Britain: Hearing on Spy’s Death
Raises Questions of a Russian Role
